Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Fields
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Fields 
    Field and Description
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avcodec.AV_CODEC_CAP_TRUNCATED
    Use parsers to always send proper frames.
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avcodec.AV_CODEC_FLAG_TRUNCATED
    use codec parsers for packetizing input
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avfilter.av_abuffersink_params_alloc()
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avfilter.av_buffersink_params_alloc()
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avutil.av_d2str(double)
    use av_asprintf() with "%f" or a more specific format
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avutil.av_get_colorspace_name(int)
    use av_color_space_name()
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avcodec.av_init_packet(AVPacket)
    This function is deprecated. Once it's removed, sizeof(AVPacket) will not be a part of the ABI anymore.
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avutil.av_mallocz_array(long, long)
    use av_calloc()
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avutil.av_tempfile(BytePointer, PointerPointer, int, Pointer)
    as fd numbers cannot be passed saftely between libs on some platforms
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avcodec.avcodec_get_frame_class()
    This function should not be used.
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avdevice.avdevice_capabilities_create(AVDeviceCapabilitiesQuery, AVFormatContext, AVDictionary)
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avdevice.avdevice_capabilities_create(PointerPointer, AVFormatContext, PointerPointer)
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avdevice.avdevice_capabilities_free(AVDeviceCapabilitiesQuery, AVFormatContext)
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avdevice.avdevice_capabilities_free(PointerPointer, AVFormatContext)
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.global.avfilter.avfilter_pad_count(AVFilterPad)
    Use avfilter_filter_pad_count() instead.
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.avcodec.AVCodecContext.debug_mv()
    unused
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.avcodec.AVCodecContext.sub_text_format()
    unused
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.avcodec.AVCodecContext.thread_safe_callbacks()
    the custom get_buffer2() callback should always be thread-safe. Thread-unsafe get_buffer2() implementations will be invalid starting with LIBAVCODEC_VERSION_MAJOR=60; in other words, libavcodec will behave as if this field was always set to 1. Callers that want to be forward compatible with future libavcodec versions should wrap access to this field in #if LIBAVCODEC_VERSION_MAJOR < 60
    org.bytedeco.ffmpeg.avformat.AVIOContext.written()
    field utilized privately by libavformat. For a public statistic of how many bytes were written out, see AVIOContext::bytes_written.
